title: @Riot, @Meddler some context on lulu
body: This is like my 7th post and no response i am going crazy not knowing what your gonna do to solo lane lulu. I just really dont want you guys to keep nerfing her becausee thats like her entire history. Thats why support lulu is so weak.

replies.body:
Changes we're testing below, with the goal of making her a bit more vulnerable in some match ups, while preserving her survivability against AD damage dealers.

* Base stats
        Base Armor increased :: 19 >>> 23
        Base Health reduced :: 553 >>> 518
* Pix, Faerie Companion (Passive)
        Pix can trigger Tribute (from the Spellthief item line) once per Lulu basic attack (instead of never triggering it at all)

19 base armor.
+ 13 armor quints
+72 hp seals
+36 hp
+3% hp

PEHP at lvl 1 for Lulu pre change = 898.7
PEHP at lvl 1 for Lulu post change = 876.9

2.5% reduction in PEHP at lvl 1 in exchange for...a QoL buff that will psychologically encourage players to trade/cast less often which will deal less overall damage...?


Maybe it's better when she peaks at lvl 5?

Pre change: 1351.8
Post change: 1336.3

Nope, still fucking worse.


Look, if you want to say that she's too tanky early on and want to do some asymmetrical squishification to her early game, ok. I disagree that she's really that tanky, but ok. It's better than misconstruing nerfs and somehow saying this is a net buff by shifting her power.

A shift in her power would be if you guys fixed her bug where flat block is taken TWICE per auto (once for the AD and once for Pix), effectively making her lvl 1 Pix useless. THAT would be a good buff if you're going to make her squishier.

The only buff I can see if that the armor increase lets me have one more PEHP every 10 seconds when I use coin. I really don't care about Lulu nerfs anymore. Quite frankly, 2.5% isn't going to make or break a significant portion of my games; I'm not diamond. It's the spinning of change after change and after change as a buff when it's a nerf that really hacks me off.

It doesn't make me think you're lying; it makes me think you guys have no freaking idea about Lulu. Just let Xypherous have his way with her so she can be nerfed to Yorick's level. At least it will screw with the enemy's mind when I do well with her.
We're not trying to present this as a buff overall. This is a nerf to Lulu overall, done in a way that should have noticeably lower impact for support Lulu/solo Lulu against physical damage dealers.
So what is the plan to buff her support play? Or is she just going to be left weaker while that is figured out?

This is Riot saying "Dammit, you're a Support. STAY OUT OF THE OTHER LANES!!!!!!"

Riot has a history of forcing Support champions solely into the Support role (see, for example, the Soraka rework). Meanwhile, if a non-Support champion becomes a Support (Morgana, Trundle, Nautilus), that's perfectly fine.

No, Lulu is fine in either. See: Lulu, Karma, Zyra working in both. Varus, Ezreal, Corki working Mid/Bot. Nautilus working Top/Support. You're injecting your own assumed intent and cherry-picking examples and saying, "Yep, this is a pattern." The issue with Soraka is that consistent self-healing often ends up being extremely problematic, as once you hit enough mana regen to keep the spell up, you no longer have gameplay in the lane.

Lulu may not be super common in NA/EU. But she is almost 100% red side ban or blue side first pick in both Korea and China and finally growing in Western popularity. League of Legends is played globally and honestly, the Asian teams just end up being faster at picking up on this. In short: Lulu is overpowered in solo lanes right now.

So let's circle back to these changes.

Most mid lane and some top lane matchups are magic damage focused. Very few bottom lane matchups are. Her durability is now roughly equal vs physical (plus, hp5, damage blocking via the defensive masteries, potions, and her shield further inflate the value of armor) but definitely weaker vs. magic. Thus, Lulu is weaker in solo lane matchups more than in support matchups. Plus the Spellthief buffs on her.

TL:DR Lulu was balanced before and the Meta Shifted around her.  Why not focus on the root reason why Lulu is so contested?

I find it a little frustrating that the first impulse is to nerf solo lane lulu without really looking at WHY Lulu is hot right now.  Lulu hasn't had a meaningful change since 4.13 and that was a nerf.  And yet recently she has seen only recently been seen as a contested pick again.  Lulu is such a contested pick because hyper-carries, like Vayne, Jinx, and Tristana are all really strong right now.  Lulu is picked to amplify those carries in their ability to carry.  Nerfing solo lane Lulu won't fix the pattern for why she was picked in the first place.  It's only a stop gap that will push players on to other champs with similar play styles like Orianna or Karma.  Lulu is just the best champ currently in the most common metagame being played in competitive League.

There are a few reasons why hypercarries are strong right now, including nerfs to counters and the changes to IE, but I think that Lulu is just a symptom of a larger issue in League that needs to be addressed.  Lulu might be too strong right now, but when hyper-carries are brought back in line, nerfs to her might make solo lane Lulu too weak.  Maybe, maybe not.  But it is good to consider.

Not sure how I feel about these changes. 
On one hand, these changes would make Lulu a bit more vulnerable in lanes by lowering her effective HP, even with the base armor increase. Most champions nowadays have some sort of mixed damage.
Supports often run Armor/Health Runes, so making a few swaps between them could minimize the effects of these changes. Allowing Pix to trigger an extra proc of Tribute may make it easier in some duo-lane matchups where poking is more difficult. In others, there would barely be an effect, as a good Lulu would be constantly poking anyways. It does make it a little more forgiving, but I wouldn't really say this is the help that Support Lulu needs. (Especially if Lulu decides to go with the Talisman line.)

One thought I've played around with is changing the way Lulu's passive works to be more supportive than straight up offensive. 
Instead of firing bolts that deal X +%AP damage based on level, maybe it could be something like..:

Lulu is assisted by Pix, a faerie, who fires a barrage of 3 bolts to her target every time she uses a basic attack against an enemy.
Each bolt adds 1 stack of Glitter to the first enemy it hits, and lasts for X seconds. (Max Y stacks, decays over time.) 
Casting Help, Pix! on an ally transfers Pix's help to them for the duration.
Allied Champions with Help, Pix! on them will deal an additional Z% damage per stack of Glitter on the enemy per basic attack.

The idea is to make it so that Lulu doesn't always have that extra damage which happens to scales off AP (which Support Lulu doesn't get as much of, compared to Lane Lulu). This would weaken Lane Lulu since the current passive helps in trades and last-hitting.
For Support Lulu, her straight up damage from pokes would be decreased, but with coordination with her lane partner, could end up doing more damage in trades/fights.
Could also lower the scaling of Glitterlance a bit and have it add some extra stacks of Glitter if an enemy is hit, to further tone down Lane Lulu while helping Support Lulu.
(Though this idea overall makes things more complicated, so I don't _completely_ like it either. Balancing sure is tough =x)
